alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; De Kalb; Fentress; Overton; Putnam; White (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 21 at 3:59AM CDT until July 21 at 4:15AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN OVERTON...NORTHWESTERN CUMBERLAND...NORTHEASTERN DE KALB...NORTHERN WHITE...PUTNAM AND SOUTHWESTERN FENTRESS COUNTIES... At 358 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles east of Monterey to near Sparta, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Cookeville, Sparta, Smithville, Algood, Monterey, Baxter, Pleasant Hill, Dowelltown, Grimsley, Hamptons Crossroads, Bakers Crossroads, Burgess Falls State Park, Rickman, Clarkrange, Crawford and Edgar Evans State Park. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 270 and 315. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cumberland; De Kalb; Fentress; Overton; Putnam; White
